tweets.text: @CastroPodcasts This is a really efficient way to burn up all the good will with the people who care most about your app and have already shown their desire to support it. This is really gross.

@CastroPodcasts Took a few seconds of searching twitter to see I am not alone in thinking this is a really gross way to treat people who paid for this app. This should not be a setting I have to change and I shouldnt have to click an ad to fix it. 

Do better. I RT’d other frustrated pro users.

@CastroPodcasts @TylerSustare You guys hiding this in a setting is snakey and gross, I guess you are not familiar with emoji. Make it the default for people who have paid money for your app not to see ads. Pal.
RT @PlzShutUpJoey: @CastroPodcasts really disappointed that I’m now seeing ads in my inbox for an app I paid for before it was made free. D…
RT @emhrt_: @CastroPodcasts I’m a paying subscriber and you did an update that pushed promoted podcasts?  Why would I pay you to see ads?…
Hey @CastroPodcasts why are you showing me ads in the app when I have already paid you for a pro membership? https://t.co/sGDIHesBY4
@mattcassinelli @amyhoy Endorsement or subtweet?

posts.dek: In which the author reflects on a festive Christmas with family, experiments with browser-based ML workflows, and creates a quirky Sonic Pi Christmas medley.
